titlestmt.subtitle: An inventory of its records at Syracuse University
titlestmt.sponsor:
The adult education holdings are collectively known as the
.

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.abstract: The Council of National Organizations gathers information on educational agencies for public use. Collection includes general files containing correspondence and printed material on member groups.

bioghist.head: Biographical History
bioghist.p: The Council of National Organizations for Adult Education (CNO) was founded in 1952 as a subsidiary organization of the American Education Association of the USA, or AEA-USA (now the American Association for Adult and Continuing Education or AAACE). "to establish closer communication and exchange of experience between organizations and individuals working in different fields." Its primary function was to gather information on educational agencies for public use.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents of the Collection
scopecontent.p:
The
Council of National Organizations Records contains a single series, General files. Most of the material ison specific councils, organizations, associations, U.S. government departments, etc., and the folders contain either correspondence or printed information.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: The files remain in the order they were received, and are in neither alphabetical nor chronological order.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p:
&scrc_name; has the papers and records of numerous organizations and individuals relating to adult education. Please refer to &subjindex; for a complete listing. The interested researcher may also wish to refer to the
Alexander Charters Library of Resources for Educators of Adults (http://scrc.syr.edu/charterslibrary).

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The majority of our archival and manuscript collections are housed offsite and require advanced notice for retrieval. Researchers are encouraged to contact us in advance concerning the collection material they wish to access for their research.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Written permission must be obtained from SCRC and all relevant rights holders before publishing quotations, excerpts or images from any materials in this collection.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows:
